sentences.sContent: Then you must be stronger than us.

sentences.sCn: 星耀天空。

sentences.sContent: The stars were twinkling overhead (= shining and quickly changing from bright to faint ) .
sentences.sCn: 头顶上星星闪烁。

sentences.sContent: The test was easy.
sentences.sCn: 考试很容易。

sentences.sContent: Finishing the task will not be easy.
sentences.sCn: 完成这项任务并不容易。

sentences.sContent: There must be an easier way to do that.
sentences.sCn: 一定有更容易的方法去做那件事。

sentences.sContent: instructions that are easy to follow
sentences.sCn: 易于掌握的使用说明

sentences.sContent: It would have been easy for the team to lose the game.
sentences.sCn: 球队本来是很容易会输掉这场比赛的。

sentences.sContent: Having you here does make things a lot easier for me.
sentences.sCn: 对我来说，有你在这里事情的确好办多了。

sentences.sContent: The station is within easy reach of (= close to ) the town centre.
sentences.sCn: 车站离市中心不远。

sentences.sContent: The park is within easy walking distance (= close enough to walk to ).
sentences.sCn: 公园很近，步行便可到达。

sentences.sContent: I looked your address up in the personnel file.
sentences.sCn: 我从人事档案里查到了你的地址。

sentences.sContent: The place looks completely different now.
sentences.sCn: 这地方现在完全变了。

sentences.sContent: They decided to try a radically different approach.
sentences.sCn: 他们决定尝试一种全然不同的办法。

sentences.sContent: We found women had significantly different political views from men.
sentences.sCn: 我们发现女性的政治观点与男性大不相同。

sentences.sContent: a slightly different way of doing things
sentences.sCn: 稍有区别的做事方法

sentences.sContent: What actually happened was subtly different from the PR people’s version.
sentences.sCn: 实际情况与公关部那些人的说法有细微的差别。

sentences.sContent: The show is refreshingly different from most exhibitions of modern art.
sentences.sCn: 这次展览与大多数现代艺术展不一样，令人耳目一新。

sentences.sContent: The publishing business is no different from any other business in this respect.
sentences.sCn: 从这一点来讲，出版业和其他任何行业没有什么差别。

sentences.sContent: It’s a different world here in London.
sentences.sCn: 伦敦这儿的情况完全不同。

sentences.sContent: games for active youngsters
sentences.sCn: 活跃好动的年轻人玩的游戏

sentences.sContent: She’s over 80, but is still very active.
sentences.sCn: 她80多岁了，但仍旧很活跃。

sentences.sContent: I'll race you to the bus stop.
sentences.sCn: 我要和你赛一赛，看谁先跑到汽车站。

sentences.sContent: Her coach encouraged her throughout the marathon race to keep on running.
sentences.sCn: 她的教练在马拉松赛全程鼓励她继续不断奔跑。

sentences.sContent: Nothing ever happens in this town.
sentences.sCn: 这镇上从来都不会发生什么特别的事。

sentences.sContent: There’s nothing in this box.
sentences.sCn: 这盒子里什么也没有。

sentences.sContent: There was nothing else the doctors could do.
sentences.sCn: 医生们没有别的办法了。

sentences.sContent: He had nothing more to say.
sentences.sCn: 他没有更多要说的了。

sentences.sContent: We know nothing about her family.
sentences.sCn: 我们对她的家庭一无所知。

sentences.sContent: I couldn’t just stand by and do nothing.
sentences.sCn: 我不能就那样袖手旁观。

sentences.sContent: I promised to say nothing about it to anyone.
sentences.sCn: 我答应这件事对谁也不说。

sentences.sContent: We’ve heard nothing from her for weeks.
sentences.sCn: 我们好几个星期没有她的音信了。

sentences.sContent: There’s absolutely nothing to be ashamed of.
sentences.sCn: 根本没有什么好难为情的。

sentences.sContent: ‘Do you know much about business?’ ‘Nothing at all.’
sentences.sCn: “你对做生意了解得多吗？”“一窍不通。”

sentences.sContent: She had eaten virtually nothing at supper.
sentences.sCn: 晚饭她几乎什么也没吃。

sentences.sContent: There’s nothing wrong with the data.
sentences.sCn: 这些数据没什么差错。

sentences.sContent: There’s nothing new about this.
sentences.sCn: 这没有什么新鲜的。

sentences.sContent: A brief search was made but they found nothing untoward.
sentences.sCn: 他们简单地搜查了一番，没发现任何异常。

sentences.sContent: It’s an interesting thought.
sentences.sCn: 这想法很有趣。

sentences.sContent: The thought that I might not have a job next year is a bit troubling.
sentences.sCn: 想到明年可能失业我有点心烦。

sentences.sContent: He felt the press of modern life.
sentences.sCn: 他感觉到现代生活的压力。

sentences.sContent: I felt lonesome in the strange land.
sentences.sCn: 在那陌生的地方我觉得寂寞。

sentences.sContent: She felt colour flame up in her cheeks.
sentences.sCn: 她感到脸上火辣辣地红了起来。

sentences.sContent: Imagine you’re a cheetah and you see two juicy gazelles grazing in the grass.
sentences.sCn: 想像你是一个猎豹, 你看见两只味道鲜美的瞪羚正在草地上吃草.

sentences.sContent: Police and wildlife experts were called to the scene, and the injured cheetah was later caught by a pest control worker.
sentences.sCn: 警察和动物救护专家都被召集到了现场，这头受伤的猎豹后来被一名有害物控制人员抓获。

sentences.sContent: accidents caused by trips or falls
sentences.sCn: 由绊倒或摔倒引起的事故

sentences.sContent: And yet, when they woke Jesus, he said to them, “Why are you afraid?
sentences.sCn: 可是，他们叫醒主耶稣时，主耶稣对他们说：“你们这小信的人哪！

sentences.sContent: To my surprise, I woke up in my bed the next morning.
sentences.sCn: 令我惊讶的是，第二天早上我醒来时发现在我的床上。

sentences.sContent: Have you ever woke up and forgot how to speak English?
sentences.sCn: 你有过一觉醒来忘记怎么说英语的经历吗？

sentences.sContent: I had lots of dreams last night.
sentences.sCn: 昨晚我做了很多梦。

sentences.sContent: She was looking straight at me.
sentences.sCn: 她直直地看着我。

sentences.sContent: Terry was so tired he couldn’t walk straight.
sentences.sCn: 特里累得路都走不直了。

sentences.sContent: He was sitting with his legs stretched straight out in front of him.
sentences.sCn: 他坐着，两条腿向前伸得直直的。

sentences.sContent: He had a knife in his right hand.
sentences.sCn: 他右手拿着一把刀。

sentences.sContent: a scar on the right side of her face
sentences.sCn: 她右颊上的疤痕

sentences.sContent: ‘What’s your name?’ she asked.
sentences.sCn: “你叫什么名字？”她问道 。

sentences.sContent: Don’t ask him – he won’t know.
sentences.sCn: 别问他，他不知道。

sentences.sContent: That kid’s always asking awkward questions .
sentences.sCn: 那孩子总是问一些尴尬的问题。

sentences.sContent: ‘Report back to me in an hour, sergeant.’ ‘Yes, sir.’
sentences.sCn: “一小时后向我报告，中士。”“是，长官。”

sentences.sContent: Can I help you, sir?
sentences.sCn: 我能为您效劳吗，先生？

sentences.sContent: Sir! You dropped your wallet.
sentences.sCn: 先生！ 您的钱包掉了。

sentences.sContent: That’s an interesting question.
sentences.sCn: 那是一个有趣的问题。

sentences.sContent: a really interesting TV programme
sentences.sCn: 十分有趣的电视节目

sentences.sContent: Did you meet any interesting people?
sentences.sCn: 你见过什么有意思的人吗？

sentences.sContent: It’s interesting that no one remembers seeing the car.
sentences.sCn: 竟然没人记得见过这辆车，真是有趣。

sentences.sContent: Her beauty is of the Italian type.
sentences.sCn: 她的美是意大利型的。

sentences.sContent: The game terminated in a victory for Italian team.
sentences.sCn: 比赛以意大利队获胜告终。

sentences.sContent: How could they be Italian?
sentences.sCn: 他们怎么会是意大利人呢？

sentences.sContent: He took her out for a five-course dinner in a fancy restaurant.
sentences.sCn: 他带她到一家豪华餐厅吃了一顿有五道菜的晚餐。

sentences.sContent: The company runs a chain of restaurants.
sentences.sCn: 公司经营连锁饭店。

sentences.sContent: A new restaurant has just opened across the road.
sentences.sCn: 马路对面刚开了一家新饭馆。

sentences.sContent: ...the last piece of pizza.
sentences.sCn: …最后一块比萨饼。

sentences.sContent: We moved to Center Street when I was young.
sentences.sCn: 在我小时候，我们搬到了中心大街。

sentences.sContent: She lives just a few streets away.
sentences.sCn: 她的住处就在几条街外。

sentences.sContent: I walked on further down the street .
sentences.sCn: 我继续沿着马路走。

sentences.sContent: Someone just moved in across the street .
sentences.sCn: 街对面有人刚刚搬进来。

sentences.sContent: a car parked on the other side of the street
sentences.sCn: 停在街对面的一辆车

sentences.sContent: She got loads of presents.
sentences.sCn: 她收到了许多礼物。

sentences.sContent: What did you get for Christmas?
sentences.sCn: 你圣诞节收到了什么礼物？

sentences.sContent: We get a lot of junk mail.
sentences.sCn: 我们收到许多垃圾邮件。

sentences.sContent: I got a few games free when I bought my computer.
sentences.sCn: 我买电脑的时候得到了几个免费的游戏。

sentences.sContent: With GPS, they also now know where you are whenever you have your phone.
sentences.sCn: 利用全球定位系统，只要你带着电话，他们就知道你在哪里。

sentences.sContent: Used in combination with GPS, an accelerometer, a compass and the gyroscope can be used for in indoor navigation with floor accuracy.
sentences.sCn: 与全球定位系统、加速度计、陀螺仪和指南针结合使用，可用于具有地面精度的室内导航。

sentences.sContent: There are already USB GPS devices for tracking where you’ve been but here’s another device that will instead keep track of what the temperature was, if for some reason you need to know.
sentences.sCn: 已经有USB全球定位系统设备以追踪你的位置所在。 但是，如果你因某个原因需要知道温度的话,还有一个设备可以代替来追踪记录温度。

sentences.sContent: Air bags are a standard feature in most new cars.
sentences.sCn: 气囊是大多数新车的标准配置。

sentences.sContent: Striped tails are a common feature of many animals.
sentences.sCn: 尾巴上有条纹是许多动物的共同特征。

sentences.sContent: The hotel’s only redeeming features (= things that make it acceptable ) were that it was cheap and near the city centre.
sentences.sCn: 这家旅馆仅有的可取之处就是价格低廉并且靠近市中心。

sentences.sContent: One of the distinguishing features (= features that are different from other things of the same sort ) of modern banking is its dependence on computers.
sentences.sCn: 现代银行业的显著特征之一就是依赖电脑。

sentences.sContent: Are those men following us?
sentences.sCn: 那些人在跟着我们吗？

sentences.sContent: The patrol car followed the BMW for a few miles and then lost it.
sentences.sCn: 巡逻车跟了那辆宝马几英里，后来就跟丢了。

sentences.sContent: Tom’s already gone out to Rome and his wife and children will follow shortly.
sentences.sCn: 汤姆已经去罗马了，他的妻儿很快就会跟着去。

sentences.sContent: He started to explain, but he didn’t get far (= he did not succeed in saying very much ) before Mary interrupted him.
sentences.sCn: 他开始解释起来，但没说几句就被玛丽打断了。

sentences.sContent: Many people felt that the new law did not go far enough (= did not have a big enough effect, so that more needed to be done ) .
sentences.sCn: 许多人认为新的法律力度不够。

sentences.sContent: I’ll tell you all about it when I get back.
sentences.sCn: 我回来再告诉你这一切。

sentences.sContent: Sheppard was telling the truth .
sentences.sCn: 谢泼德说的是实话。
